item.title: Higher arrivals pounds mustard
item.description: <p/><p/>Sluggish demand and higher arrivals have pounded both mustard oil and mustard seeds in mandis across Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan and Gujarat. With arrivals outstripping demand, mustard oil in...

item.title: Is structured commodity finance a hidden bubble?
item.description: The entry of commodities trading firms in structured finance has resulted in excess lending capacity

item.description: <p/><p/>The rice market is likely to rule without much change on account of steady demand and ample stocks for the next few days, said trade experts.With not much trading taking place in the...

item.title: Sugar jumps further on seasonal demand
item.description: <p/><p/>Sugar prices increased further by ₹20-30 a quintal on the Vashi wholesale market on Thursday narrowing gap between cost of purchase from mills and market price which till now rules below pa...

item.title: India’s spice exports surge 41% during April-Dec 2013
item.description: Riding on the excellent export performance of mint, chilli and seed spices, India’s spice exports has registered a 41 per cent growth in terms of rupee value during April-December 2013.

item.title: Crude oil prices mixed in Asia after strong US data
item.description: Crude oil prices were mixed in Asian trade today, taking a breather after surging on strong US economic data, analysts said. New York’s main contract, West Texas Intermediate (WTI) for Ma...

item.title: Will the stagnant demand in commodities encourage hedging
item.description: The market may be responsive to fundamentals rather than any momentum trading
